decks.notes: The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board while applying pressure with efficient creatures and spells. It utilizes cheap removal, counterspells, and hand disruption to control the game tempo. The deck aims to quickly close out the game by efficiently removing threats and presenting powerful creatures like Murktide Regent. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and helps dig for key cards, while Brazen Borrower offers flexibility in dealing with opposing threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's proactive game plan and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back onto the battlefield using spells like Entomb and Reanimate. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win condition. The inclusion of various card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder helps the player dig through the deck to find the necessary combo pieces. Overall, the deck relies on a strong graveyard interaction to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This Dragon Stompy deck focuses on disrupting opponents by shutting down their lands with cards like Magus of the Moon, Blood Moon, and Sundering Eruption. It also uses aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers to quickly end the game. The deck utilizes fast mana sources such as Chrome Mox and Ancient Tomb, along with disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Pithing Needle. The goal is to lock down opponents' resources while maintaining a strong board presence and closing out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on utilizing the reanimation mechanic to quickly bring powerful creatures back from the graveyard, such as Murktide Regent, Archon of Cruelty, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck includes cards like Entomb and Reanimate to facilitate this strategy, while also running disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. Additionally, cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brainstorm help with card selection and digging for key pieces. The deck also includes a mana denial plan with Wasteland and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure through efficient creatures and spells. By utilizing disruption cards like Daze, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will, the deck aims to control the game and prevent the opponent from executing their strategy. Meanwhile, Nethergoyf, Murktide Regent, and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares provide a fast clock to win the game. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps to draw into the necessary cards, while Fatal Push and Orcish Bowmasters provide removal options. This deck excels at tempo plays and maintaining board control.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to aggressively lock down the opponent's mana base with cards like Magus of the Moon, Blood Moon, and Chalice of the Void while quickly deploying threats like Fury, Pyrogoyf, and Broadside Bombardiers to pressure the opponent and close out the game. The deck also utilizes efficient mana acceleration with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox to power out its big threats early on. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting a fast clock to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through lands and denying resources to the opponent. Key elements include Dark Depths combo with Thespian's Stage, Life from the Loam for land recursion, and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan with cards like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Boseiju, Who Endures, while also generating value with cards like Urza's Saga and Exploration. Overall, the deck leverages powerful land interactions to control the board and ultimately secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and powerful threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Delver of Secrets, and Murktide Regent to apply early pressure on opponent while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also leverages card selection spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to find the right threats and answers quickly. The mana base is optimized for consistency with fetchlands like Scalding Tarn and Misty Rainforest, alongside some utility lands like Wasteland. Overall, this deck aims to be proactive and efficient in its aggression.

The deck focuses on filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back onto the battlefield quickly to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's strategy, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using a variety of removal spells, counter spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for extra value by blinking permanents for additional triggers. The deck's reliance on card advantage and controlling the board aims to outlast opponents and grind out wins over time. Additionally, the mana base includes a variety of lands to ensure consistency in casting spells of different colors.

This combo-reanimator deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then bringing them back with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and interact with the opponent's strategy. Cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Murktide Regent provide card advantage and alternate win conditions. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful reanimated creatures.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the board using counterspells and removal spells, while also utilizing cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Teferi, Time Raveler to gain card advantage and control the game. It also features land disruption with cards like Back to Basics and Magus of the Moon, as well as a toolbox approach with versatile cards like Prismatic Ending. The deck aims to out-value and out-control the opponent, while also having access to powerful finishers like Thundertrap Trainer and Flame of Anor.

This deck focuses on using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield quickly. It also utilizes cards like Entomb and Brainstorm to set up the graveyard. With cards like Daze and Force of Will for protection, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly assembling its own win condition. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Wasteland helps the deck stay ahead in the game and control the board.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategy with a mix of creature and spell-based damage. It includes cards that disrupt the opponent's hand and board presence while building up its own creatures for a quick victory. The deck also has a minor sacrifice theme with cards like Goblin Bombardment and Cabal Therapy. It has a solid mana base with access to different colors for flexibility in casting its spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly before they can set up their own game plan.

This deck focuses on disruption and card advantage while applying pressure on the opponent. It utilizes efficient removal and hand disruption spells to control the game early on, while using powerful creatures like Baleful Strix and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to provide a steady stream of threats. The inclusion of Life from the Loam allows for consistent land drops and graveyard recursion, while cards like Scythecat Cub and Traveling Chocobo provide additional aggressive options. The mana base is built to support a variety of colors for the deck's versatile spells and creatures.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back into play with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces, along with disruptive cards like Brazen Borrower and Archon of Cruelty to control the board. The strategy revolves around efficiently reanimating high-impact creatures to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. It combines powerful and disruptive elements to create a fast and resilient combo strategy.
